      class  AWRSnapshotHelper.SnapshotRange

    • Method Detail

      • getAWRSnapshotRange

        public java.lang.String getAWRSnapshotRange(java.util.Date startTime,
                                            java.util.Date endTime)
        Given start time and end time of the event of interest, find the relevant snapshot range and returns formatted string in the form of [start id]-[end id]. If no relevant snapshot is found, the ID is left as empty. Example return values: "15-17", "3-8", "4-", "-5", "-"
        Parameters:
        startTime - The start time; may be null.
        endTime - The end time; may be null.
        Returns:
        snapshot range of interest as a formatted string of snapshot IDs

      • getSnapshotRangeForPeriod

        public AWRSnapshotHelper.SnapshotRange getSnapshotRangeForPeriod(java.util.Date startTime,
                                                                 java.util.Date endTime)
        Given start time and end time of the event of interest, returns the relevant snapshot range as a SnapshotRange object.
        Parameters:
        startTime - The start time; may be null.
        endTime - The end time; may be null
        Returns:
        snapshot range of interest as a SnapshotRange object
